casebody.data:
The State of Ohio, Appellant and Cross-Appellee, v. McCauley, Appellee and Cross-Appellant.

[Cite as State v. McCauley, 104 Ohio St.3d 158, 2004-Qhio-6398.]

(No. 2003-1346 Submitted October 26, 2004 Decided December 8, 2004.) William D. Mason, Cuyahoga County Prosecuting Attorney, and Richard Bombik, Assistant Prosecuting Attorney, for appellant and cross-appellee. Robert L. Tobik, Cuyahoga County Public Defender, and Paul A. Kuzmins, Assistant Public Defender, for appellee and cross-appellant.

{¶ 1} The judgment of the court of appeals is reversed, and the cause is remanded to the trial court for resentencing consistent with State v. Jordan, 104 Ohio St.3d 21, 2004-Ohio-6085, 817 N.E.2d 864.

Moyer, C.J., Resnick, F.E. Sweeney, Pfeifer, Lundberg Stratton, O’Connor and O’Donnell, JJ., concur.
